glsa.title: Snack: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in Snack could result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.

background.p: Snack is a sound toolkit for creating multi-platform audio applications with scripting languages.

description.p: The GetWavHeader() function in jkSoundFile.c does not have boundary checks when parsing format sub-chunks or unknown sub-chunks.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted WAV file with an application using Snack, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Snack users should upgrade to the latest version:
